maml:description.maml:para: Configure Active Directory Domain Services (ADDS) certificate.

In cases where ADDS does not automatically pick up the LDAPS certificate from the Local Computer cert store, it can be necessary to explicitly import the cert into the NTDS Service store. Intended to be used with the output from Posh-ACME's New-PACertificate or Submit-Renewal.
This requires elevated/admin access on the domain controller.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new certificate for the DC and domain's FQDNs and add configure Active Directory to use it for LDAPS.

maml:description.maml:para: Configure Exchange service to use the specified certificate.
Intended to be used with the output from Posh-ACME's New-PACertificate or Submit-Renewal.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The name of the Exchange services to configure. Defaults to 'IIS,SMTP'.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
The name of the Exchange services to configure. Defaults to 'IIS,SMTP'.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new certificate and configure it for Exchange on this system.
Renew a certificate and configure it for Exchange on this system.

maml:description.maml:para: Configure RD Session Host service to use the specified certificate.
Intended to be used with the output from Posh-ACME's New-PACertificate or Submit-Renewal.

This function is dependent on the IISAdministration module version 1.1.0.0 or greater which can be installed from the PowerShell Gallery. https://blogs.iis.net/iisteam/introducing-iisadministration-in-the-powershell-gallery
Some of the SSL binding flags like DisableTLS13 might not be supported on older versions of IIS.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
If specified, the "Disable HTTP/2" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable Legacy TLS" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable OCSP Stapling" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable QUIC" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable TLS 1.3 over TCP" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the -Force switch will be passed through to New-IISSiteBinding which should only be necessary if there are multiple Sites using the same binding.
The "Host name" value for the site binding. If empty, this binding will respond to all names. You can also pass an array of names to create a binding for each name in the array.
The listening IP Address for the site binding. Defaults to '*' which is "All Unassigned" in the IIS management console.
The listening TCP port for the site binding. Defaults to 443.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
If specified, the "Require Server Name Indication" box will be checked for the site binding.
The IIS web site name to modify bindings on. Defaults to "Default Web Site".
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
If specified, the "Disable HTTP/2" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable Legacy TLS" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable OCSP Stapling" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable QUIC" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the "Disable TLS 1.3 over TCP" box will be checked for the site binding.
If specified, the -Force switch will be passed through to New-IISSiteBinding which should only be necessary if there are multiple Sites using the same binding.
The "Host name" value for the site binding. If empty, this binding will respond to all names. You can also pass an array of names to create a binding for each name in the array.
The listening IP Address for the site binding. Defaults to '*' which is "All Unassigned" in the IIS management console.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The listening TCP port for the site binding. Defaults to 443.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
If specified, the "Require Server Name Indication" box will be checked for the site binding.
The IIS web site name to modify bindings on. Defaults to "Default Web Site".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new certificate and add it to the specified IIS website on the default port.
Renew a certificate and and add it to the specified IIS website on the default port.

The "Host name" value for the site binding. If empty, this binding will respond to all names. Supported only on IIS 8.0 or higher.
The listening IP Address for the site binding. Defaults to '*' which is "All Unassigned" in the IIS management console.
The listening TCP port for the site binding. Defaults to 443.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
If specified, the "Require Server Name Indication" box will be checked for the site binding. Supported only on IIS 8.0 or higher.
The IIS web site name to modify bindings on. Defaults to "Default Web Site".

The "Host name" value for the site binding. If empty, this binding will respond to all names. Supported only on IIS 8.0 or higher.
The listening IP Address for the site binding. Defaults to '*' which is "All Unassigned" in the IIS management console.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The listening TCP port for the site binding. Defaults to 443.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
If specified, the "Require Server Name Indication" box will be checked for the site binding. Supported only on IIS 8.0 or higher.
The IIS web site name to modify bindings on. Defaults to "Default Web Site".

maml:description.maml:para: Configure RD Session Host service to use the specified certificate.
Intended to be used with the output from Posh-ACME's New-PACertificate or Submit-Renewal.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.

The control channel policy that should be configured for the FTP site: SslRequire, SslAllow, or SslRequireCredentialsOnly. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/configuration/system.applicationhost/sites/site/ftpserver/security/ssl for details.

The data channel policy that should be configured for the FTP site: SslRequire, SslAllow, or SslDeny. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/configuration/system.applicationhost/sites/site/ftpserver/security/ssl for details.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
The IIS FTP site name.
If specified, enable 128-bit encryption for SSL connections to the FTP site.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.

The control channel policy that should be configured for the FTP site: SslRequire, SslAllow, or SslRequireCredentialsOnly. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/configuration/system.applicationhost/sites/site/ftpserver/security/ssl for details.

The data channel policy that should be configured for the FTP site: SslRequire, SslAllow, or SslDeny. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/configuration/system.applicationhost/sites/site/ftpserver/security/ssl for details.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
The IIS FTP site name.
If specified, enable 128-bit encryption for SSL connections to the FTP site.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new certificate and add it to the specified IIS FTP site.
Renew a certificate and and add it to the specified IIS FTP site.

maml:description.maml:para: Configure a NPS Network Policy to use the specified certificate for MS PEAP.
Intended to be used with the output from Posh-ACME's New-PACertificate or Submit-Renewal.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The path to the NPS config file you want to edit. Default: %SystemRoot%\System32\ias\ias.xml
The name of the Network Policy.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The path to the NPS config file you want to edit. Default: %SystemRoot%\System32\ias\ias.xml

An XPath expression that returns one or more Network Policies with an msEAPConfiguration element. An example that would return all policies might be '//RadiusProfiles//Children/*[descendant::msEAPConfiguration]'. This is for advanced usage where you are updating multiple policies with the same certificate.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.
Thumbprint/Fingerprint for the certificate to configure.
The path to the NPS config file you want to edit. Default: %SystemRoot%\System32\ias\ias.xml
Path to a PFX containing a certificate and private key. Not required if the certificate is already in the local system's Personal certificate store.
The export password for the specified PfxFile parameter. Not required if the Pfx does not require an export password.
The name of the Network Policy.

An XPath expression that returns one or more Network Policies with an msEAPConfiguration element. An example that would return all policies might be '//RadiusProfiles//Children/*[descendant::msEAPConfiguration]'. This is for advanced usage where you are updating multiple policies with the same certificate.
If specified, the old certificate will be deleted from the local system's Personal certificate store. Ignored if the old certificate has already been removed or otherwise can't be found.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new certificate and add it to the specified NPS Network Policy.
Renew a certificate and and add it to the specified NPS Network Policy.
